moves.8. Nf3: I do not like 8. f4 which weakens too much the white king.
moves.9. O-O O-O 10. Bf4: attacking the d pawn and developping the DSB which is often a problem for white in the Benoni.
moves.10... Qc7 11. e5: White opts for the central attack.
moves.11... Nh5 12. exd6: Neglecting the h knight attack for the moment.
moves.13... Bxc3 14. Be7 Bg7: The DSB is back again in his lair after a raid.
moves.15... Rd8: I didn't saw the poit of this move.
moves.16. Bxd8 Qxd8: Now material is equal again. White has two passed pawns unsupported. The center is wide opened. White will have to drawback on the queenside.
moves.17. Rfe1: Occupate the open file seems the first thing to do.
moves.18. Bxd7: I saw little good space for the bishop so that it's as well to trade. But it's probably a mistake.
moves.20... Bc6 21. Ne5: To carry on attacking for i didn't want to let the initiative to black but it was a mistake.
moves.25... Bxe8 26. Rxe8+ Bf8: Now white is 3 points late in mateial.
moves.30. Rxb7: One pawn is better than nothing.
moves.30... Qf3 31. Rexe7: Trading one rook against bishop and knight, so that material will be almost equal, although in endgame, black with his queen will be Superior.
moves.31... Nxe7 32. Rxe7 a6: Now, white fights for the draw and black for the win. White has to block the situation, taking, if possibe the a and c black pawns.
moves.34. Rxc5: No real choice, since one of the a and b pawns had to be taken anyway.
moves.34... Qxb2 35. Ra5 Qb6: protecting the pawn and menacing the rook.
moves.37... Qc5 38. Kg2: To avoid an attack with the black queen on the 1 line
moves.40. Rd4 Qb6 41. Rc4: If 41. Rxa4  Qc6+ and the rook is lost.
moves.41... h5 42. h3: White need an escape square on h2
moves.42... Qb7+ 43. Kh2 Qf3 44. Kg1 Qa8 45. a: The situation is blocked. Black offers a draw. (Accepted). I did a lot of mistakes by attacking foolishly and am lucky to obtain it.
